title: Is it legal to publish a book explanation? - Quora

response.answer_text: What? Like Sparknotes? Sure, if you wrote the explanation (its not copyright infringement) or unless you live in a country that sensors certain ideas and that your explanation would qualify as inapropriate in this regard. In the US, it’s even permissible to quote substantial portions from the source book for the purpose of supporting your explanation. Regardless, if you have any doubts, check with a local attorney as none of this is legal advice.

Yes. Think of Cliff’s Notes and other types of study aides. There are many “Guide to” books out there. You should definitely consult an IP attorney to see what is legal and what is not in terms of quoting a book that is still in copyright.
